content:
HtmlFormAdapter Class

In this Article

Provides the form adapter class (that is, the adapter for the Form) for the HTML adapter set. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")]
public class HtmlFormAdapter : System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlControlAdapter

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • ControlAdapter
  • System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlControlAdapter
  • HtmlFormAdapter

Constructors summary

HtmlFormAdapter()

Creates a new instance of the HtmlFormAdapter class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Properties summary

Control

Returns a strongly typed reference to the associated control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Methods summary

DisablePager()

Disables the pager user interface (UI) for the current request. Can be called by an adapter to prevent pagination UI from being generated.
Render(HtmlMobileTextWriter)

Called by the control's Render method to perform rendering. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
RenderBodyTag(HtmlMobileTextWriter,IDictionary)

Renders the <body> tag. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
RenderExtraHeadElements(HtmlMobileTextWriter)

Renders any additional content within the <head> and </ head> tags of the HTML page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
RenderPager(HtmlMobileTextWriter)

Renders the pager user interface (UI) for the form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
RenderPagerTag(HtmlMobileTextWriter,Int32,String)

Renders a pager tag on paginated forms. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
ShouldRenderFormTag()

Returns whether to render a form tag. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Constructors

  • HtmlFormAdapter()

    Creates a new instance of the HtmlFormAdapter class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public HtmlFormAdapter ();

Properties

  • Control

    Returns a strongly typed reference to the associated control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form Control { get; }

    Property Value

    • Form

      A strongly typed reference to the associated control.

Methods

  • DisablePager()

    Disables the pager user interface (UI) for the current request. Can be called by an adapter to prevent pagination UI from being generated.

    protected void DisablePager ();
  • Render(HtmlMobileTextWriter)

    Called by the control's Render method to perform rendering. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override void Render (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter writer);

    Parameters

    • writer
      HtmlMobileTextWriter

      The text writer to receive output.

  • RenderBodyTag(HtmlMobileTextWriter,IDictionary)

    Renders the <body> tag. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual void RenderBodyTag (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter writer, System.Collections.IDictionary attributes);

    Parameters

    • writer
      HtmlMobileTextWriter

      The text writer.

    • attributes
      IDictionary

      The specified <body> attributes.

    Remarks

    The base implementation renders a <body> tag with the given attributes. Inheriting adapters can override this method and modify the dictionary of attributes before calling the base implementation. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

  • RenderExtraHeadElements(HtmlMobileTextWriter)

    Renders any additional content within the <head> and </ head> tags of the HTML page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual bool RenderExtraHeadElements (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter writer);

    Parameters

    • writer
      HtmlMobileTextWriter

      The specified text writer.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if any extra head elements were written; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This method is called twice. On the first call, the writer parameter is null, and the method returns true or false, indicating whether or not it has additional <head> elements to write. On the second call, the method writes the content by using the provided writer.

  • RenderPager(HtmlMobileTextWriter)

    Renders the pager user interface (UI) for the form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual void RenderPager (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter writer);

    Parameters

    • writer
      HtmlMobileTextWriter

      The text writer.

  • RenderPagerTag(HtmlMobileTextWriter,Int32,String)

    Renders a pager tag on paginated forms. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual void RenderPagerTag (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter writer, int pageToNavigate, string text);

    Parameters

    • writer
      HtmlMobileTextWriter

      Specifies the output stream.

    • pageToNavigate
      Int32

      Contains the page number of the destination page.

    • text
      String

      Specifies the text used for the link.

    Remarks

    This method writes a link to the output stream. The link appears on paginated forms to enable to the user to navigate between a form's pages.

  • ShouldRenderFormTag()

    Returns whether to render a form tag. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual bool ShouldRenderFormTag ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if a form tag should be rendered; otherwise, false.
